description: The woman shared the pictures on Imgur Thursday (pictured), explaining that her beloved Cash's livers and kidneys were failing, prompting his overs to put an end to his suffering.
title: Dog owner celebrates her pet before he is put down
title_page: Dog owner celebrates her pet before he is put down | Daily Mail Online
text:
A heartbroken dog owner has shared a series of photos celebrating her nine-year-old pet as she prepared to fly home for his last day.
The woman, who goes by Thedoctorsmistress on Imgur, shared the pictures Thursday, explaining that her beloved Cash's livers and kidneys were failing, prompting his overs to put him to sleep to end his suffering.
She explained how she 'basically forced' her parents to rescue the dog off the streets when he was just over three weeks old, and celebrated the happy life he ended up having as a cherished pet.
The pet lover, recounted how Cash grew up to weigh more than 130 pounds, having developed a healthy appetite for pizza crusts.
A heartbroken dog owner shared a series of photos of her nine-year-old dog Cash (pictured) Thursday as she prepared to fly home for his last day
The woman, who is believed to be from South Africa, included this photo of Cash posing happily next to a pile of toys and blankets ready to be donated to a shelter
'Flying home to be with my dog for his last day tomorrow. Don't think I've been this sad before,' the woman wrote above her touching series of pictures.
Her photos paid homage to some of Cash's favorite hobbies, such as taking scraps of paper out of the trash and 'making a mess'.
She said her pet had grown up to be one of the most-loved dogs, on one occasion stepping in as 'quality assurer' when her boyfriend baked dog treats.
Her posts showed Cash next to a stock of toys, which he shared with the family's two other dogs, and happily posing next to a some other toys and blankets ready to be donated to a shelter.
The woman, who is thought to be from South Africa, explained that Cash always preferred empty paper rolls or pieces of paper to his own toys, and that he would always begin the night curled up in a ball only to spread out in his sleep.
The series of pictures paid tribute to two of Cash's favorite hobbies: begging for pizza crusts and playing with scraps of papers while 'making a mess'
The woman said her pet had grown up to be one of the most-loved dogs, on one occasion stepping in as 'quality assurer' when her boyfriend baked dog treats (pictured)
Cash's liver and kidneys have been failing and have kept the dog from eating. The family has made the painful decision to end his suffering
'He has always been scared of the North wind,' she wrote. 'No idea why other than it probably makes specific noises he isn't too fond of. This means he would often find the nooks to hide in. Most popular was behind the toilet or between the couch and the side table.'
The dog had a hip operation at one point, after which his owners had to be careful to keep his weight under control.
His liver and kidney failure eventually kept Cash from eating properly, at which point the family made the painful decision to put him down.
After learning about the dog's illness, the woman had made her parents promise her they'd notify her in time for her to fly home and say goodbye to her pet.
Other dog lovers told her in the comments about their own losses and said how much the post had moved them.
Cash's owner ended her commemorative post on a loving note, writing: 'He has been the best boy and I will miss him more than I can explain.'
